Sequence Information.Family: Belongs to the frog skin active peptide family (Brevinin subfamily)
Sequence Information.Target Organism: [Ref.19843479]Gram-positive bacteria:Staphylococcus aureus ATCC2592 (MIC=1.25 µg/mL), Bacillus pumilus (MIC=2.5 µg/mL), Bacillus cereus (MIC=7.5 µg/mL);Gram-negative bacteria:Escherichia coli ATCC25922 (MIC=12.5 µg/mL), Bacillus dysenteriae (MIC=7.5 µg/mL), Acinetobacter calcoaceticus (MIC=12.5 µg/mL), Psecdomonas aeruginosa (MIC=50 µg/mL);Yeast:Candida albicans ATCC2002 (MIC=2.5 µg/mL).
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: [Ref:19843479] It has 17% hemolytic activity at 100 μg/mL against rabbit red blood cells
Sequence Information.Cytotoxicity: No cytotoxicity information found in the reference(s) presented
Sequence Information.Function: Esculentin-2-Alb exhibits hemolytic activity against rabbit red blood cells.

Literature.Title: Five novel antimicrobial peptides from skin secretions of the frog, Amolops loloen.
Literature.Reference: Comp Biochem Physiol B Biochem Mol Biol. 2010 Jan;155(1)72-76.
Literature.Author: Wang M, Wang Y, Wang A, Song Y, Ma D, Yang H, Ma Y, Lai R.
